content.raw:
Installing libraries in `lib/x86_64-linux-gnu` subdirectory on Debian systems even when not installing in `/usr` is a bug in the CMake version distributed with Trusty, that 
was fixed in CMake 3.0 . [1] So it is worth mentioning that this step is necessary only for Trusty, not `Trusty or greater`. [2]

The fact that only on one distribution the behavior changes can be fixed by fixing `CMAKE_INSTALL_LIBDIR` in that specific case ( `CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX` != `/usr`) , but perhaps is a bit late to fix this kind of problem in an old release of Gazebo. 

[1] : http://public.kitware.com/pipermail/cmake-developers/2014-January/009435.html

[2] : http://packages.ubuntu.com/search?keywords=cmake
